Container.Name: Palworld
Container.Overview:
This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install Palworld and run it.
**Server Name:** Palworld Docker **Password:** Docker **Admin Password:** adminDocker
**Configuration:** The configuration is located at: .../Pal/Saved/Config/LinuxServer/PalWorldSettings.ini
**ATTENTION:** First Startup can take very long since it downloads the gameserver files!
Update Notice: Simply restart the container if a newer version of the game is available.
You can also run multiple servers with only one SteamCMD directory!
Container.DonateText: If you like my work please

Config.Name: GAME_ID
Config.Description: The GAME_ID that the container download at startup. If you want to install a static or beta version of the game change the value to: '2394010 -beta YOURBRANCH' (without quotes, replace YOURBRANCH with the branch or version you want to install).

Config.Name: Game Parameters
Config.Description: Enter your game parameters (for a community server put in the value 'EpicApp=PalServer' without quotes)

Config.Name: Extra Game Parameters
Config.Description: Enter your Extra Game Parameters seperated with a space and - (eg: -No-useperfthreads -NoAsyncLoadingThread)

Config.Name: Update Public IP
Config.Description: If set to 'true' the container will check on each container start if the Public IP is still valid (the container will try to grab your public IP on the first server start since the public IP is necessary to run a community server).

Config.Name: Enable Backups
Config.Description: Set this value to 'true' to enable the automated backup function from the container, you find the Backups in '.../palworld/Backups/'. Set to 'false' to disable the backup function.

Config.Name: Backup Interval
Config.Description: The backup interval in minutes (ATTENTION: The first backup will be triggered after the set interval in this variable after the start/restart of the container)

Config.Name: Backups to Keep
Config.Description: Number of backups to keep (by default set to 12 to keep the backups of the last 24 hours)

Config.Name: UDP1 - Game Port
Config.Description: UDP Gameport (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the port number in your config)

Config.Name: TCP - RCON
Config.Description: Default RCON Port (don't forward that in your router, RCON is only meant for local access and RCON is unencrypted - RCON is by default disabled in the config you have to first enable it in the config if you want to use it)

Config.Name: Steam-Username
Config.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Steam-Password
Config.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

Config.Name: Validate Installation
Config.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.
